intro: Urtica viridis, commonly known as common nettle, is a herbaceous plant native to Europe, Asia, and North Africa. It is characterized by its heart-shaped leaves with serrated edges and dense clusters of tiny, stinging hairs on both sides. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–100 cm and thrives in moist, fertile soil. Urtica viridis is an annual or biennial plant that flowers with small, greenish-white flowers in umbel-like clusters. It plays an important role in supporting pollinators and is sometimes used in traditional medicine.
